statement: A specimen of titanium alloy is tested in tension. If the engineering strain is $0.002$ and the Modulus of Elasticity is $110\text{ GPa}$, calculate the corresponding engineering stress. Assume the material remains in the elastic region.

A 60-kg woman holds a 9-kg package as she stands within an elevator which briefly accelerates upward at a rate of $g/4$. Determine the force $R$ which the elevator floor exerts on her feet. Use $g = 9.81\text{ m/s}^2$.

A 60-kg woman holds a 9-kg package as she stands within an elevator which briefly accelerates upward at a rate of $g/4$. Determine the lifting force $L$ which she exerts on the package during the acceleration. Use $g = 9.81\text{ m/s}^2$.

category: Torsional Shear Stress and Torsional Deformation
statement: A solid steel shaft with a diameter of $50\text{ mm}$ is subjected to a torque of $1.5\text{ kNm}$. Calculate the maximum shear stress $\tau_{max}$ in the shaft.

category: Shearing Forces and Bending Moments in Beams
statement: A $4\text{-m}$ long simply supported beam carries a concentrated load of $10\text{ kN}$ at its midspan. Determine the maximum bending moment $M_{max}$ occurring in the beam.
A rectangular beam ($b=100\text{ mm}, h=200\text{ mm}$) is subjected to a bending moment of $20\text{ kNm}$. Calculate the maximum bending stress $\sigma_{max}$ at the top fibers.

A rectangular beam section experiences a vertical shear force of $50\text{ kN}$. If the section dimensions are $b=80\text{ mm}$ and $h=150\text{ mm}$, find the maximum shear stress $\tau_{max}$ at the neutral axis.
A cantilever beam of length $L=3\text{ m}$ supports a point load $P=5\text{ kN}$ at its free end. If $EI = 2000\text{ kNm}^2$, calculate the maximum deflection $\delta_{max}$ at the tip.

A point in a structural member is subjected to a tensile stress $\sigma_x = 80\text{ MPa}$ and a shear stress $\tau_{xy} = 30\text{ MPa}$. Using Mohr's Circle, determine the maximum principal stress $\sigma_1$.
A 2-meter long steel rod with a cross-sectional area of $400\text{ mm}^2$ is subjected to an axial tensile load of $80\text{ kN}$. If $E = 200\text{ GPa}$, calculate the total elongation $\delta$.

An aluminum bar is constrained between two rigid walls. If the temperature increases by $50^\circ\text{C}$, calculate the magnitude of the thermal stress $\sigma$ induced. ($E = 70\text{ GPa}$, $\alpha = 23 \times 10^{-6}/^\circ\text{C}$)
A 10-mm diameter titanium specimen is pulled in tension. The axial strain is $0.002$. If $\nu = 0.33$, calculate the absolute change in diameter $|\Delta d|$.
